intro: Psychotria phaneroplexa, commonly known as the showy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. It produces small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged oppositely along the stems. Psychotria phaneroplexa is often found growing in shaded, moist environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
